overview:
## Discussion

Connections start in an inactive state. You must call [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSXPCListener/activate()] on a connection before it can send or receive any messages.

Calling [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSXPCListener/activate()] on an active connection has no effect.

For backward compatibility reasons, calling [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSXPCListener/resume()] on an inactive and otherwise not suspended [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSXPCListener] has the same effect as calling [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSXPCListener/activate()]. For new code, prefer [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSXPCListener/activate()].

# activate()

**Instance Method**

Activates the listener.

## Declaration

```swift
func activate()
```

## Discussion

Connections start in an inactive state. You must call [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSXPCListener/activate()] on a connection before it can send or receive any messages.

Calling [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSXPCListener/activate()] on an active connection has no effect.

For backward compatibility reasons, calling [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSXPCListener/resume()] on an inactive and otherwise not suspended [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSXPCListener] has the same effect as calling [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSXPCListener/activate()]. For new code, prefer [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSXPCListener/activate()].

## Managing connection state

- **resume()**: Starts processing of incoming requests.
- **invalidate()**: Invalidates the listener.
- **suspend()**: Suspends the listener.
title: activate()
